headline: Garland Feels the Heat
author: Julie Kelly
sentences: Appointed attorney general in 2021 as some sort of retaliation against Republicans for refusing to seat him on the Supreme Court in 2016, Garland, though largely a figurehead, is getting heat from members of both political parties—including the man who nominated him to serve as the nation’s top lawyer.
According to the New York Times, Joe Biden is displeased that Garland hasn’t yet charged the former president for crimes related to the Capitol protest on January 6, 2021.
Attorney General Merrick Garland’s swan song, we can presume, isn’t exactly turning out how he had hoped.
